abstract.p: Far Horizons tour company of Albuquerque, NM, is offering trip to Easter Island during Tapati Festival; map (S)

block.p: Known locally as Rapa Nui, Easter Island in the South Pacific is famous for its hieroglyphiclike tablets and colossal figures carved from volcanic rock. The 64-square-mile island, about 2,300 miles west of Santiago, Chile, has nearly a thousand immense stone statues and hundreds of petroglyphs, line drawings carved into rock.

Far Horizons, a tour company in Albuquerque, N.M., is conducting a trip to Easter Island during the Tapati Festival, a weeklong celebration of the Rapa Nui culture. Accompanied by a historian and linguist who speaks Rapanui, visitors will spend three nights in Santiago and five nights on Easter Island.

The 64-square-mile island, about 2,300 miles west of Santiago, Chile, has nearly a thousand immense stone statues and hundreds of petroglyphs, line drawings carved into rock.

Far Horizons, a tour company in Albuquerque, N.M., is conducting a trip to Easter Island during the Tapati Festival, a weeklong celebration of the Rapa Nui culture. Accompanied by a historian and linguist who speaks Rapanui, visitors will spend three nights in Santiago and five nights on Easter Island.

The trip, Jan. 26 to Feb. 4, costs $3,995 a person, double occupancy, including most meals and air fare from Santiago but not a required $100 tax-deductible donation to the Easter Island Foundation. More information is available at (800) 552-4575, or at www.farhorizon.com.

The Archaeological Travel Service, a tour company on Easter Island, leads excursions of three to eight days. The tours, which range from $900 to $4,000 per person, double occupancy, are escorted by archaeologists who specialize in Polynesia. Transportation on the island, lodging and most meals are included, but not air fare to Easter Island, usually from Santiago or Papeete, Tahiti. The trips visit the main archaeological sites and natural attractions and offer the chance to meet local residents. The tour company can be reached at (56-32) 100-364, fax (56-32) 100-532, or at www.rapanui.cl (click on Tourism and then Tour Agencies).
